Nice to meet you, I’m Michael. You can call me Michael, Mike or Mikey.

Mikey, what is it you actually do? I help teams produce purposeful solutions with design thinking, product experience, and business awareness. Leaning heavily on user needs, storytelling, and leading on creative direction for projects that scale.

Currently at Department for Work and Pensions (GOV.UK), with over 15 years of experience, working among multi-disciplinary teams designing digital products to leading on services within the public sector.
Learn more about me

Still asking what I do?

User Experience Design

Leaning heavily on user needs, storytelling, and leading on creative direction for projects that scale.

Design & Product Strategy

Leading workshops, and playback sessions to assist in aligning all team members to a shared goal and vision with the aim of finding out what matters most to the user and the business.

Team Management & Leadership

Helping team members find growth and career development. Experienced at hiring and providing onboarding framework to assist with retention.

I’ve had the privilege of influencing products loved and used by millions.

GOV.UK - Universal Credits

Sky Sports - Super Six

Property Finder (investor pitch)

I’ve lead teams at Sky Bet, designed services at GOV.UK, helped millions play fantasy football and Super 6 for Sky Sport, assisted in rebranding Russell Hobbs, coded and designed with Premier Food Safety and worked on major brands like Argos, Jet2, British Airways, Manchester City, ITV and charities like Forward Leeds and Mount Pleasant Kennels.

I’ve also worked with multiple startups, helping launch products as lead designer and assisting my wife co-run her own company.
Check out my work

“Michael has amazing ability, both as a front-end developer and user experience designer.   The product was unquestionably better for this collaborative approach and for him always challenging the team to better meet user needs.  I whole-heartedly recommend him to any organisation that values user-centred and results driven design.”

I worked with TOM SIMCOX at DWP, where we worked on the Benefit Fraud project.
